body.p:
Louisville. Aug. 7. 1865
Gov Thos E. Bramlette
Dear Sir

On the 10th day of July Ult. you remitted the fine against Barton & Link as Securities for J. V. Gilbert -- (This Remission is enclosed) Mr Gilbert is not to blame in this matter -- It is the same offence really which you remitted before -- and I know that he has not committed any like Offence since -- He has since then wholly abandoned all games -- May I ask that you will also pardon & remit as to him. -- This Recognizance was forfeited on account of the severe illness of Mr Gilbert. which forbid his appearance in Court. -- Please return it to-morrow.
The Court will dispose of it on day after to-morrow if not pardoned.
